intro: Cleonia lusitanica, commonly known as the Iberian cleonia, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in scrubland and woodland habitats. It has finely divided, aromatic leaves and small white or greenish flowers. Cleonia lusitanica is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
